alert.note: Alert for Cimarron; Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 8:59PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Texas, eastern Cimarron, Sherman and Moore Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 859 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Eva to 3 miles north of Stratford to 10 miles east of Conlen to 3 miles south of Dumas. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dumas, Stratford, Cactus, Sunray, Eva, Griggs, Texhoma and Sturgis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
